page.title: 15INDUSTRY
page.content: The other Mills: NEW YORK MILL: was opened in 1825 and the thread was sent down to the weaving mill in Knaresborough. In 1883 after a great flood the mill was bought by Thomas Gill and sons who started producing string. In 1965 the mill started spinning fibres for carpet weaving and it finished production in 1980. Today, New York is the site for many small businesses, namely a gun delaer, a welder, a joiner, a wine distributer and a carpet wholesaler and manufacturer, to name but a few. The Summerbridge Fire Station is based there and many of the former workers' cottages have now been modernized and become private dwellings. One of the mills in Low Laithe is now a restaurant,but all others there and in Smelthouses are private residences.
